inclusion.criterion: Non-smokers or ex-smokers with less than 5 pack/year history
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Treatment with continuous or near continuous (>50% of year) oral corticosteroids
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Requirement for treatment with high dose inhaled corticosteroids (ICS)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Minor characteristics: Requirement for daily treatment with a controller medication in addition to ICS e.g. LABA, theophylline, leukotriene antagonist
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Persistent airways obstruction (FEV1 <80% predicted, diurnal PEF variation >20%)
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: One or more emergency care visits for asthma per year
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Prompt deterioration with ≤ 25% reduction in oral or ICS
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Near fatal asthma event in the past
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Current smokers, or less than 3 years since quitting smoking
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Less than 4 weeks from an exacerbation
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Previous history of psychiatric disturbances on high dose prednisolone
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a 15-year-old boy with asthma diagnosed a year ago. He presents with shortness of breath, chest tightening and cough.
